questionText: On the real number line, how many integers are between <math><mo>-</mo><mfrac><mn>29</mn><mn>4</mn></mfrac></math> and <math><mfrac><mn>31</mn><mn>5</mn></mfrac></math>?
solutionText:
The first step is to convert the improper fractions into decimals to define the boundaries of our range.

1. Convert the fractions:
-294=-7.25
315=6.2

2. Identify the boundary integers:
The integers must be greater than -7.25 and less than 6.2.
The smallest integer in this range (the 'first') is -7.
The largest integer in this range (the 'last') is 6.

3. Use the counting formula:
To count the number of integers in an inclusive range, the most reliable method is the formula: Last-First+1.
6-(-7)+1=6+7+1=14
There are 14 integers in this range.
